sentences.sContent: The elderly are a formidable force in any election.
sentences.sCn: 老年人在任何选举中都是一股强大的力量。

sentences.sContent: ...and those people continue to reap rich rewards into old age because these days the educated elderly are more productive than the preceding generation...
...Young people do less cooking at home than the elderly these days...
...we may have more elderly people with substantial financial problems in the future...
...It may seem that these elderly people are trying to cheat death...
...we may be faced with a financial crisis among elderly...
...That means making some difficult decisions with elderly patients...
...So it makes sense that the elderly should be routinely screened for new tumors - or doesn't it...

...A recent study suggests that doctors start to make more objective decisions about who will truly benefit from screening- especially considering the explosion of the elderly that will soon swell our population...
...Researchers have found that caring for the elderly can be a very positive experience...
...Why are adult children more likely to use community services to help care for elderly parents...
